title: Communist Party Adviser Purchases Trump Memecoin for VIP Dinner Access
summary: He Tianying, a Chinese tech executive and delegate to the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference, purchased $3.7 million of Trump's memecoin to secure a private dinner with the president, revealing deep constitutional concerns about foreign influence and presidential access through cryptocurrency.
description: He Tianying, a delegate of the Fangshan CPPCC (Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference), purchased $3.7 million worth of Trump's memecoin, positioning himself among the top 220 buyers and earning a private dinner with the president at his golf club near Washington, D.C., while raising serious ethical and legal questions about foreign access to the president.

notes: Comprehensive investigation reveals significant constitutional and ethical concerns. Justin Sun, a Chinese-born crypto entrepreneur, confirmed purchasing $18.6 million in Trump-themed meme tokens. Democratic senators Adam Schiff and Elizabeth Warren urged investigation into potential 'pay to play' corruption. Constitutional experts note potential violations of foreign influence restrictions.
